intro: Saussurea formosana, commonly known as the Taiwan safflower, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and is adapted to cooler, humid climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its roots are often used in traditional medicine. Saussurea formosana plays an important role in the local biodiversity and is a symbol of Taiwan's unique flora.
